description: This notification is issued when cmpccPreloadErrorNotifEnabled
is set to true, and an error occurs in preloading as indicated
0 indicates PCRF has sent an incomplete Policy object.
1 indicates a mandatory AVP in the preloading message is
2 indicates PCEF is not able to install/modify/remove a policy
3 indicates PCRF sent the preloading objects in wrong order.
4 indicates PCRF tried to preload an object, which is already
255 indicates no error has occurred so far.

Summary.eval: ($v1 == 1) ? 'Preloading has reported $v2 Data Inconsistancies' : (($v1 == 2) ? 'Preloading has reported $v3 AVP missing' : (($v1 == 3) ? 'Preloading has reported $v4 Enforce Failures' : (($v1 == 4) ? 'Preloading has reported $v5 Static Config Conflicts' : (($v1 == 5) ? 'Preloading has reported $v6 Wrong Order Failures' : 'Preloading reported normal'))))

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-MOBILE-POLICY-CHARGING-CONTROL-MIB::ciscoMobilePolicyChargingControlPreloadError CISCO-MOBILE-POLICY-CHARGING-CONTROL-MIB::cmpccppsErrorState i 1 CISCO-MOBILE-POLICY-CHARGING-CONTROL-MIB::cmpccppsPreloadDataInconsistent c 9999 CISCO-MOBILE-POLICY-CHARGING-CONTROL-MIB::cmpccppsAVPMissing c 9999 CISCO-MOBILE-POLICY-CHARGING-CONTROL-MIB::cmpccppsEnforceFailures c 9999 CISCO-MOBILE-POLICY-CHARGING-CONTROL-MIB::cmpccppsStaticConfigConflicts c 9999 CISCO-MOBILE-POLICY-CHARGING-CONTROL-MIB::cmpccppsWrongOrderFailures c 9999

description: This notification is generated when rollback of an object
fails, which indicates that object could be out of sync. The
cmpccppsRollbackFailedReason present in the varbind list
indicates the reason that triggers the sending for
identifies the entity that implements the PCEF functionality of

Summary.eval: ($v2 == 1) ? 'No rollback error has occurred' : 'Rollback of $v2 has failed'
